programme.title: Brussels, My Love?
programme.desc: From the economy to the climate and the EU's role in world affairs, this talk show sheds light on European affairs and the issues that impact on our daily lives as Europeans.

programme.title: Kingsman: The Golden Circle
programme.desc: (2017) Taron Egerton returns as the newest recruit to the stylish secret agency Kingsman for more ass kicking comedy action. A star-studded cast includes Julianne Moore and Elton John.

programme.title: Paul
programme.desc: (2011) Sci-fi comedy. On a road trip across the USA, two British UFO geeks (Simon Pegg and Nick Frost) make pals with a potty-mouthed alien (voiced by Seth Rogen). With Sigourney Weaver.

programme.title: Been So Long
programme.desc: (2018) Musical romance. Michaela Coel stars as a single mum who's turned her back on love until she's persuaded to go on a rare night out in the vibrant north London community of Camden.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Anne of the Indies
programme.desc: (1951) Jean Peters plays the title role of a brave buccaneer who falls for Captain LaRochelle (Louis Jourdan) without realising he has been planted in her crew to capture her.

programme.title: The Last Hurrah
programme.desc: (1958) Satirical, political drama with Spencer Tracy. Ruthless mayor Frank Skeffington seeks re-election for the fifth and final time. But have his old tactics run their course?

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: (1960) A western from Budd Boetticher. A hero and an outlaw must work together to save a kidnapped woman from a band of warring Comanche. Starring Randolph Scott and Nancy Gates.

programme.title: The Ghost and Mrs Muir
programme.desc: (1947) Supernatural romance starring Rex Harrison as the spirit of a gruff sea captain who haunts widow Gene Tierney, only for her to fall in love with him. Directed by Joseph L Mankiewicz.

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: (2004) Sci-fi thriller with Will Smith. In 2035, a technophobic cop investigates a crime that may have been perpetrated by a robot. Can he keep an open mind?

programme.title: Vengeance
programme.desc: (2022) BJ Novak's comedy thriller. A big-city journalist is called to rural Texas after the girlfriend he doesn't have dies. Was it murder? Is there a podcast in it? With Ashton Kutcher.

programme.title: Collateral
programme.desc: (2004) Michael Mann's crime thriller starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx. A hitman arrives in Los Angeles to do five hits in just one night, with the unwitting help of a cab driver.

programme.title: Possessor
programme.desc: (2020) Brandon Cronenberg's mind-bending, adults only sci-fi shocker. A contract killer who takes possession of people's consciousness struggles with her latest subject. Adults only.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck!
programme.desc: (1960) Second World War drama. Kenneth More stars as the British captain charged with finding and destroying the Bismarck, Germany's largest battleship. Directed by Lewis Gilbert.

programme.title: Hue & Cry
programme.desc: (1947) The very first Ealing comedy is set in the post-war East End. A boy tries to catch a gang of thieves who are using his favourite comic to communicate their dastardly deeds.

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: (1968) Burt Lancaster stars as the angst-ridden middle-aged man who decides to swim home via neighbour's pools in Frank and Eleanor Perry's superb allegorical drama.

programme.title: The Sons of Katie Elder
programme.desc: (1965) Western. John Wayne stars as John Elder, the oldest of four brothers who are out to avenge the murder of their mother. With Dean Martin and Dennis Hopper.

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: (2006) Comedy-drama starring Anne Hathaway and Meryl Streep. A naive young woman lands a job as assistant to one of New York's most important, but ruthless and cynical, magazine editors.

programme.title: Boss Level
programme.desc: (2020) Groundhog day shoot 'em up with Frank Grillo, Naomi Watts and Mel Gibson. Ray gets killed every day. Can he escape by unravelling the mystery of why a bunch of people want him dead?

programme.title: Memento
programme.desc: (2000) Christopher Nolan's Oscar-nominated thriller with Guy Pearce. A man tracking his wife's killer has no short-term memory so must find other ways to piece together the evidence.

programme.title: All Eyez on Me
programme.desc: (2017) Biographical drama about legendary American rapper Tupac Shakur, from his early life with his Black Panther parents, to his huge success and tragic death

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Quiet Man
programme.desc: (1952) John Wayne stars in John Ford's comedy as a US boxer, retired to Ireland, who courts the fiery Mary Kate (Maureen O'Hara), despite her brother's (Victor McLaglen) violent objections.

programme.title: The Long Ships
programme.desc: (1964) Adventure with Richard Widmark as a Viking who leads his men on the quest for a huge bell made of solid gold, but with Sidney Poitier, leader of an army of Moors, on the trail too.

programme.title: Von Ryan's Express
programme.desc: (1965) Second World War adventure. Frank Sinatra stars as the leader of Allied prisoners of war attempting to slip the clutches of their Italian captors. Co-starring Trevor Howard.

programme.title: Cutthroat Island
programme.desc: (1995) Swashbuckling adventure. Geena Davis and Matthew Modine star as pirates racing to find the missing parts of their treasure map and beat an evil rival (Frank Langella) to the booty.

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back
programme.desc: (2016) Action-thriller sequel with Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders and Danika Yarosh. Vigilante Jack Reacher gets simultaneously caught up in a deadly conspiracy and a paternity case.

programme.title: The French Dispatch
programme.desc: (2021) Wes Anderson's star-encrusted tribute to the New Yorker magazine covers the final edition of a chaotic fictional publication, following the death of its editor - Bill Murray.

programme.title: Kingsman: The Golden Circle
programme.desc: (2017) Taron Egerton returns as the newest recruit to the stylish secret agency Kingsman for more ass kicking comedy action. A star-studded cast includes Julianne Moore and Elton John.

programme.title: Paul
programme.desc: (2011) Sci-fi comedy. On a road trip across the USA, two British UFO geeks (Simon Pegg and Nick Frost) make pals with a potty-mouthed alien (voiced by Seth Rogen). With Sigourney Weaver.

programme.title: Been So Long
programme.desc: (2018) Musical romance. Michaela Coel stars as a single mum who's turned her back on love until she's persuaded to go on a rare night out in the vibrant north London community of Camden.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Anne of the Indies
programme.desc: (1951) Jean Peters plays the title role of a brave buccaneer who falls for Captain LaRochelle (Louis Jourdan) without realising he has been planted in her crew to capture her.

programme.title: The Last Hurrah
programme.desc: (1958) Satirical, political drama with Spencer Tracy. Ruthless mayor Frank Skeffington seeks re-election for the fifth and final time. But have his old tactics run their course?

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: (1960) A western from Budd Boetticher. A hero and an outlaw must work together to save a kidnapped woman from a band of warring Comanche. Starring Randolph Scott and Nancy Gates.

programme.title: The Ghost and Mrs Muir
programme.desc: (1947) Supernatural romance starring Rex Harrison as the spirit of a gruff sea captain who haunts widow Gene Tierney, only for her to fall in love with him. Directed by Joseph L Mankiewicz.

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: (2004) Sci-fi thriller with Will Smith. In 2035, a technophobic cop investigates a crime that may have been perpetrated by a robot. Can he keep an open mind?

programme.title: Vengeance
programme.desc: (2022) BJ Novak's comedy thriller. A big-city journalist is called to rural Texas after the girlfriend he doesn't have dies. Was it murder? Is there a podcast in it? With Ashton Kutcher.

programme.title: Collateral
programme.desc: (2004) Michael Mann's crime thriller starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx. A hitman arrives in Los Angeles to do five hits in just one night, with the unwitting help of a cab driver.

programme.title: Possessor
programme.desc: (2020) Brandon Cronenberg's mind-bending, adults only sci-fi shocker. A contract killer who takes possession of people's consciousness struggles with her latest subject. Adults only.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck!
programme.desc: (1960) Second World War drama. Kenneth More stars as the British captain charged with finding and destroying the Bismarck, Germany's largest battleship. Directed by Lewis Gilbert.

programme.title: Hue & Cry
programme.desc: (1947) The very first Ealing comedy is set in the post-war East End. A boy tries to catch a gang of thieves who are using his favourite comic to communicate their dastardly deeds.

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: (1968) Burt Lancaster stars as the angst-ridden middle-aged man who decides to swim home via neighbour's pools in Frank and Eleanor Perry's superb allegorical drama.

programme.title: The Sons of Katie Elder
programme.desc: (1965) Western. John Wayne stars as John Elder, the oldest of four brothers who are out to avenge the murder of their mother. With Dean Martin and Dennis Hopper.

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: (2006) Comedy-drama starring Anne Hathaway and Meryl Streep. A naive young woman lands a job as assistant to one of New York's most important, but ruthless and cynical, magazine editors.

programme.title: Boss Level
programme.desc: (2020) Groundhog day shoot 'em up with Frank Grillo, Naomi Watts and Mel Gibson. Ray gets killed every day. Can he escape by unravelling the mystery of why a bunch of people want him dead?

programme.title: Memento
programme.desc: (2000) Christopher Nolan's Oscar-nominated thriller with Guy Pearce. A man tracking his wife's killer has no short-term memory so must find other ways to piece together the evidence.

programme.title: All Eyez on Me
programme.desc: (2017) Biographical drama about legendary American rapper Tupac Shakur, from his early life with his Black Panther parents, to his huge success and tragic death

programme.desc: Newcomer Max attempts to impress the team, a beginner surfer learns a painful lesson and Bondi's newest celebrity makes an appearance. (S16, ep 9)

programme.title: Bondi Rescue
programme.desc: Caught in a rip, a stubborn swimmer refuses to put his hand up. Meanwhile, Lifeguards deal with intoxicated beachgoers. (S16, ep 10)

programme.title: The Undercover Police Scandal: Love and Lies Exposed
programme.desc: Five women share their experiences of being deceived into intimate relationships with undercover police officers. Alison, Lisa and Helen were campaigners in their twenties when they first met their seemingly perfect boyfriends, but creepy clues emerged as their relationships developed. When all three women dug deeper, they discovered they had been spun a web of lies as their perfect activist boyfriends were state agents who had deceived them

programme.title: Ainsley's National Trust Cook Off
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by chefs Genevieve Taylor and Nico Reynolds at the kitchen garden of Tyntesfield in Somerset to see who can create and cook the Dish of the Day. Ainsley collects patty pan squashes for a chargrilled summer squash and spring onion with urfa chilli dressing and whipped ricotta, Genevieve creates the perfect pizza blanca topped with gorgonzola, chard and sweet red peppers, and Nico uses Tyntesfield onions in his grilled cod and prawn in a ginger and coconut broth

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan and a team of experts examine the latest horticultural trends for seasoned and aspiring gardeners alike. Alan showcases his early-blooming plants, Camilla Bassett-Smith visits the world's largest indoor rainforest to meet the team behind it, Claire Lowrie leads a houseplant masterclass for beginners, Anna Greenland answers a viewer's query on growing vegetables, and Errol Reuben Fernandes explores an inner-city community garden

programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of day two of the festival, including feature the 4.00 BetMGM Queen Mother Champion Steeple Chase, plus races at 1.20, 2.00, 2.40, 3.20 and 4.40. With analysis from AP McCoy, Ruby Walsh, Megan Nicholls and Luke Harvey, reports by Mick Fitzgerald, Alice Plunkett, Oli Bell, Rishi Persad and Matt Chapman, betting news from Brian Gleeson, and commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Can Lynwen from Mold, Rob from London, Vikki from Wellingborough and Keith from Manchester work together as a team and take down one of the country's finest quiz brains? Find out as Bradley Walsh hosts and they try to take a Chaser down for thousands of pounds

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Steph demands answers and panics Caleb, Marlon feels torn over what to do, and Manpreet is being blackmailed and watched

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Lisa informs Carla that a body has been found, Alya asserts her authority to her new business partner, and Tracy forces Tommy to choose between her and his new job

programme.title: A Cruel Love: The Ruth Ellis Story
programme.desc: Ruth is on trial for murder. The court will hear how she came to kill David Blakely and how a woman who seemingly had it all, was driven to shoot her lover dead. Drama, starring Lucy Boynton and Toby Jones

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to ¬£100,000?

programme.title: Sorry, I Didn't Know
programme.desc: Adjoa Andoh, Fatiha El-Ghorri, Richard Blackwood and Ignacio Lopez join host Chizzy Akudolu and team leaders Jimmy Akingbola and Eddie Kadi for this edition of the show.

programme.title: Long Lost Family Special: The Spanish Baby Scandal
programme.desc: The team meet with two women who believe babies from their families were stolen at birth during the historic scandal in Spain that took place from the 1930s into the early 1990s. Ruth, whose first child was born in Spain in 1992, tells Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell that she believed her daughter had died at birth but suspicions have come to light in recent years that she may have been stolen instead. Maria Elena comes to the team for help on behalf of her 93-year-old mother, Ana, who believes her twin babies born in Madrid in 1958 were also stolen

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts the game show, which sees novelty shop owner Jess, learning and development trainer Xhemal and former GP Pip spin the wheel and try to solve the word puzzles in a bid to win big money prizes, with a potential jackpot of ¬£50,000

programme.title: Scotland Tonight: A Conversation with John Barrowman
programme.desc: The Glasgow-born star of Doctor Who, Torchwood and assorted stage hits talks about his life and career

programme.title: The Undercover Police Scandal: Love and Lies Exposed
programme.desc: A mutual friend introduces Helen and Alison, and they work out that their former partners must have belonged to a Metropolitan Police squad that infiltrated left-wing groups. No-one is interested in their story and both women are forced to move on with their lives. Seven years later, an online post finally unmasks former officer Mark Kennedy, whose undercover name was Mark Stone

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Celebrity Scams: Are You At Risk? Tonight
programme.desc: With scammers impersonating celebrities, and creating fake ads that push fraudulent investments, Alex Beresford, whose own identity has been used by scammers, investigates. He also reveals what viewers can do to protect themselves

programme.title: It's Clarkson on TV
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson takes a look at the highs and lows of the small screen, judging shouty Americans, manufactured jeopardy and Tony Robinson. Back in the studio, he wins a staring match with a dog and is very brave when he is stung on the backside by an errant bee

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Action crime thriller starring Tom Cruise. When five innocent people are gunned down in Pittsburgh, all evidence points to former US Army sniper James Barr. However, Barr refuses to confess to the crime, and sends out word for ex-military investigator Jack Reacher to clear his name. Despite being no friend of Barr's, Reacher looks into the murders and discovers the victims may not have been so randomly selected after all.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: The Undercover Police Scandal: Love and Lies Exposed
programme.desc: Five women share their experiences of being deceived into intimate relationships with undercover police officers. Alison, Lisa and Helen were campaigners in their twenties when they first met their seemingly perfect boyfriends, but creepy clues emerged as their relationships developed. When all three women dug deeper, they discovered they had been spun a web of lies as their perfect activist boyfriends were state agents who had deceived them

programme.title: Ainsley's National Trust Cook Off
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by chefs Genevieve Taylor and Nico Reynolds at the kitchen garden of Tyntesfield in Somerset to see who can create and cook the Dish of the Day. Ainsley collects patty pan squashes for a chargrilled summer squash and spring onion with urfa chilli dressing and whipped ricotta, Genevieve creates the perfect pizza blanca topped with gorgonzola, chard and sweet red peppers, and Nico uses Tyntesfield onions in his grilled cod and prawn in a ginger and coconut broth

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan and a team of experts examine the latest horticultural trends for seasoned and aspiring gardeners alike. Alan showcases his early-blooming plants, Camilla Bassett-Smith visits the world's largest indoor rainforest to meet the team behind it, Claire Lowrie leads a houseplant masterclass for beginners, Anna Greenland answers a viewer's query on growing vegetables, and Errol Reuben Fernandes explores an inner-city community garden

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. programme.title: Sorry, I Didn't Know

programme.title: Long Lost Family Special: The Spanish Baby Scandal
programme.desc: The team meet with two women who believe babies from their families were stolen at birth during the historic scandal in Spain that took place from the 1930s into the early 1990s. Ruth, whose first child was born in Spain in 1992, tells Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell that she believed her daughter had died at birth but suspicions have come to light in recent years that she may have been stolen instead. Maria Elena comes to the team for help on behalf of her 93-year-old mother, Ana, who believes her twin babies born in Madrid in 1958 were also stolen

programme.title: Long Lost Family Special: The Spanish Baby Scandal
programme.desc: The team meet with two women who believe babies from their families were stolen at birth during the historic scandal in Spain that took place from the 1930s into the early 1990s. Ruth, whose first child was born in Spain in 1992, tells Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell that she believed her daughter had died at birth but suspicions have come to light in recent years that she may have been stolen instead. Maria Elena comes to the team for help on behalf of her 93-year-old mother, Ana, who believes her twin babies born in Madrid in 1958 were also stolen

programme.desc: Derek swaps the chaos of the office for rain-soaked Ripon to pick up a 1965 Ford Anglia with just 33,000 miles on the clock, while Dave's loving the clean lines of a rare Renault Caravalle.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Hukbalahap Rebels in the Philippines believe they have a new enemy - a vampire. The British claim that an RAF pilot's incredible night vision comes from eating carrots.

programme.title: WW2 - Frontlines
programme.desc: Iwo Jima: Iwo Jima was where a quarter of all the US Marines who died in World War II were killed. The Leathernecks had to re-think their tactics, as one in three became a casualty.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Eltham Palace: Fiona Bruce presents from Eltham Palace in South London, where finds include a collection of Gerry and Sylvia Anderson puppets.

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.desc: Hovercraft: The speedster tries to break the world speed record for a hovercraft, but hovercrafts are notoriously unstable at speed and Guy is out of his comfort zone on water.

programme.title: Guy Martin's WWI Tank
programme.desc: The motoring enthusiast wants to build a working replica of a First World War tank, pass the tank driving test, and drive the machine at a Remembrance Day parade in Lincoln.

programme.title: Guy Martin's Wall of Death: Live
programme.desc: Motoring enthusiast Guy Martin takes on a daring extreme world record attempt as he defies gravity on the largest Wall of Death ever made.

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson is joined by Hairy Biker Si King to visit some wild cattle at the Chillingham estate and explore the health benefits of group drumming in an outdoor music session.
